benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods - Add a payment method

covered: Invalid payload / malformed input handling (TC12, TC13, TC19, TC20)
Account existence and id validation cases (TC15, TC14)
Default payment method / isDefault flag (TC02, TC08)
Control plugins and plugin properties (TC04, TC08)
No payment methods existing vs existing methods (TC06, TC07)
Integration with downstream / plugin behavior (TC26, TC27)
Regression - backward compatibility / older client formats (TC25)
gaps: Explicit rate limiting / throttling behavior not tested

Pagination considerations are not applicable to POST creation in this story (no list endpoint tested) but guidelines mention pagination for GET; explicit GET-like pagination tests are not in scope here

Explicit validation of duplicate submission behavior under high concurrency with precise duplicate-detection semantics not separately isolated (concurrency is covered generally by TC23, but dedicated duplicate-detect-on-retry scenario could be more explicit)
recommendations: Add tests to verify caching headers and ETag behavior on POST responses where applicable (even if not strictly required, to validate caching behavior).
Add explicit rate limiting/throttling tests to ensure the API handles bursts of POST requests gracefully (TC23 covers concurrency, but not rate limits).
Clarify and possibly add a dedicated test for retry/idempotency behavior on duplicate submissions to ensure no unintended duplicates under retry scenarios.
Ensure readability of error messages across validation failures (e.g., missing fields vs invalid types) with consistent error payloads.
Include a brief accessibility check for API docs and error messages edge cases (beyond TC30) to ensure machine-readable error schemas are accessible.
